reviews_data.review_text: The place is so perfect!  The set up is comfort at its best.  Muffins/coffee amazing.  But I really want to emphasize the staff! I got to have a quick convo with one of the workers named caroline, she is truly sweet and so good at customer service. Stuff like that is what makes this place amazing.  Do not miss this place! LTH!!!
Just stopped by at 8:30 on a Saturday for a late evening latte. Doors not open. Barista didn't let us in.  Please don't advertise 10pm Saturday if your doors aren't open.
Great coffee but definitely pricey.
Very nice atmosphere and good coffee!
I have been recommended this coffee shop to all my friends, I felt in love, even with the customer service. Extra hours the best !!!!

Beautiful interior, well crafted coffee, and friendly staff. Very relaxing atmosphere, perfect for small meetups and studying / work.  * I would recommend moving to getting people's names over calling drink orders, that small change brings a personal intimacy which I think could really propel this space above competitors.
Great coffee. Located inside an apartment building I think?
Hidden gem! Great coffee, huge space with tons of seating, good wifi, decently quiet. Great place to work remotely if you need a change of scenery from your home office.
Really nice spot!!

Hidden gem! The coffee and pastries are excellent. Great to meet up with friends or catch up on work. The decor is reminiscent of a coffee shop in the city.  Don't be discouraged by the construction. Plenty of space to park in the garage.

LTH is a one of a kind coffee shop that breaks the mold from others in the area. Everyone is welcoming and the coffee (particularly the specialty drinks) always taste great. I'm a regular and every member of the staff welcomes me with a smile. Loving the new food menu and can't wait to see what they do next.
Love the vanilla chai chill! Its my favorite, super nice staff and I love their new food menu. I always treat myself to a breakfast sandwich on the weekend ♥️

I've been coming here since they opened in August of 2021 and I LOVE it. I've been recommending it to all of my friends as well. They have incredible coffee, cold brew, oat milk, vegan items, a brand new seasonal menu, 16 beers on tap, a fantastic cocktail program, kombucha, cider beers, desserts, games, TV's, chill couches, private office space, literally could go on. It's a great spot for meetings, interviews, hanging with friends and they have live music most Friday nights with food trucks. I can't say enough great things about this place and they are always adapting and adding new items based on poling their guests and residents. I heard they will be carrying fresh produce soon which will be very convenient. I come down some nights for a bottle of wine, grab a cocktail before I catch the light rail, or play pool with friends. The nice part is they are open until 9pm most nights! I highly recommend coming to check out their coffee, food and environment - it's a great location at the Scaleybark light rail station and currently have free garage and street parking!

Trash service and place now that there is new management. Coffee quality has really gone downhill and it seems like they don't really focus on it anymore. Past management and team were very friendly and I enjoyed having conversations with them. Food menu is way overpriced for meals that just get heated up from frozen. Pastries are mediocre, it would be better to just get a pastry from local bakeries nearby. Would not recommend anymore. I've watched this place fall tremendously. Definitely take your time and money somewhere else.
Decent environment, but the coffee/food is extremely overpriced and the WiFi is often spotty. Work areas have been restricted recently as well.
Cute coffee shop with the best coffee! The atmosphere is great with very friendly and sweet staff.
It is a lovely place to get coffee! The service is amazing and the place itself relaxing. If you ever want to go somewhere new and exciting come here.

As a resident who's been with LTH from it's birth at Novel, I have been incredibly disappointed and unsatisfied with what has become of this beautiful coffee shop. When it first opened, the staff was AWESOME and the vibe was unmatched. There was a sense of community, the staff was welcoming, actually cared about how you were doing and asked about where you'd been if they didn't see you for awhile. I actually knew staff NAMES and was excited to come see my friends who would always make me the most delicious cup of coffee. The staff before would see my boyfriend and I, waiting in line and by the time we'd get to the front, our order would already be waiting for us. Carlos, Mackenzie, Maggie, Deja and Tyler were the absolute best people that could've worked at that coffee shop. Now, there's new management. The menus for both coffee, drinks and food have changed. The prices are INSANE. $10 for a yogurt, $11 for a smoothie. And to top it off, the perks of being a resident have slowly dissipated (free refill on coffee with a special mug, 10% discount, etc). If you're willing to pay close to $8-$9 for a vanilla oat milk latte, this is your place. There is no sense of community anymore. A group of us, every Friday, would come to the coffee shop for Food Truck Fridays, listen to the amazing live music and have fun. Now, the place is DEAD on the weekends, there's no more food trucks or trivia. There's hardly ever live music and when there is, it's incredibly weird elevator music. The staff is not educated well enough to be serving cocktails - nor do they make the cocktails they used to have on the menu, even though they still have all of the ingredients for them. Everyone here is incredibly rude/stuck up, especially the new management. This place really was like a family. Now, this place will never have my business. I won't even go here out of desperation. Save your money and brew your own $6 bag of coffee from Harris Teeter. This place is not the vibe. BTW, my boyfriend was LITERALLY charged $1 EXTRA for getting a cold brew without ice…and was not given his 10% resident discount because after almost a year, they stopped honoring it.. Who does that?! Rude, greedy, way over priced, horrible customer service.

Place used to be awesome, but not anymore. Coffee and service has really gone downhill with the new management. Prices are ridiculous, plus they charge an extra $1 if you do not want ice in your cold brew. Prepare to spend about $15 on two coffees. I'd take my service to burr and berry down the street.

The design an atmosphere of this place is really nice. The coffee is good, bakery items are way overpriced for it feels like being frozen and reheated. Worst was the staff at the counter, very unfriendly and arrogant. Would not go again.
This place is awesome. Love the space that is offered to hang out. Coffee is delicious! Be sure to park in the parking garage area....lots of spaces.
Great staff and delicious coffee. They also have some meal options that look amazing at pretty reasonable prices. Super great place to get remote work done with friends ⭐
Beautiful place! Love the super tall ceilings and the coffee is delicious
Great atmosphere, quality coffee/tea, had a good time here visiting with my family.
Great place

Bright, spacious, and eclectic-feel coffee spot in the South End. Right off the Scaleybark stop on the Blue Line lightrail, this little gem, located on the first floor of Novel apartments, is a great place to chill with your friends over coffee, beer or tea. Nice selection of pastries and scones, as well as hand-crafted sandwiches and light lunch fare. Priced well, too.
Wow! Awesome space for large or smaller groups. Delightfully yummy foods & bevs!

A fun coffee shop inside the Novell apartment complex that is open to the public. Unique decor makes it fun including a pool table, an upstairs private seating area, and lots of comfy couches and seating areas that open up to an amazing outside area with games. Definitely worth a visit and the manager Carlos is very friendly and helpful.
Breakfast burrito was cold.
First time having a Cinna-Honey Latte and it was super good 🤤🤤🤤

Charlotte really does have some hidden gems!!! Found 1000 Hills Coffee because I was searching for a kronut (flaky, buttery, goodness made by Sugarmann). The atmosphere is definitely on point; natural lighting to die for with added accent lights. And even with the high ceiling (which I love) the background chatter is minimal, allowing for the music and the eloquent sounds of barista magic to shine through. Carlos is also a gem, fantastic customer service! I had a Caramanilla; one of their signature drinks, it was made perfectly. A well balance of coffee, milk, caramel and vanilla and not too sweet; which is perfect because I like to actually taste the coffee and not just a sugary hot drink.
So enjoyed the place. So enjoyed meeting, Maggie, she was such a nice barista to converse.

Just moved to Charlotte and I come in every day. The space in this cafe is amazing! The coffee and food is great, and all the staff is very kind and welcoming.  They have really cool themed nights as well, and cocktail/wine specials. A pool table, wicked fast internet connection, and upstairs offices.  Nothing else like it in the area. Believe me I have looked.  Also, four legged friendly!

Wow! I cannot rate this high enough! Such a cool atmosphere and every barista I've come in contact with has been SO NICE! Everyone there is so welcoming. I really feel at ease when I come here with my laptop to do schoolwork. It's calm, it's relaxing, I can really concentrate. The coffee is great and so are the breakfast foods. I like the option of an actual mug OR a paper cup! Tyler and Carlos are amazing. Couldn't recommend this place more. 10/10

I was looking forward to this coffee shop since it was near me. But that barista working 1/22/22 night shift was very unwelcoming.  Even after seeing I already took of my jacket and bookbag, and set up my laptop, he asked me if I wanted my order to go. And I sat next to the register and he didn't ask anyone else the entire 3 hours I was studying there if they wanted their orders to go. That made it indirectly very clear I was just not welcomed. I guess the barista don't like serving black people or something. Or was told to be rude to black customers, idk he was just not as friendly to me as everyone is saying in the reviews and to the other customers. Crazy thing is also, No one else seemed like they cared that a black college girl was on her laptop studying for classes except that barista. Also he did a weird hard look away from me when giving me my drink. I was none the less a paying customer studying. Not someone loitering and I tipped him, which I regret. So yeah I wouldn't come here if your black they are going to purposefully make you feel unwelcomed. And your going to regret giving them your money, like I did.
Love this place!! Definitely one of my favorites coffee shops in Charlotte. Great food & coffee, friendly staff and cool, spacious seating/ co-working area.

This place is top notch and arguably my new favorite spot. Their coffee is spot on and breakfast burritos are unreal! It's right by our office so its so easy to get in and out of with very friendly staff. Highly recommend checking this place out...I'll be back...a lot!
Hazel is amazing! She made me the best late I have ever had!

The espresso was absolutely delightful, very well and carefully crafted. The service was insanely good! It's been a while since the last we were so well served. The store is cozy and beautiful. Different spaces to meet, study, or just talk and enjoy a good coffee. 11/10!

Really cool space, pretty mediocre coffee. And I think the food is just reheated from frozen. Disappointed.  Update: some of my order was placed to go and everything was wrong. Missing items and got a cold chicken burrito instead of a sausage breakfast burrito.  Additional Update: I was refunded for my missing items.

Land of a Thousand Hills is an absolutely amazing environment! The staff is incredible and the utilization of the space they have is astonishing. If anyone needs a place to grab insanely great coffee and use work space, this is your place. Play pool, backgammon, sit outside, or simply enjoy the artwork, lighting, and music inside. A staple of Charlotte!
One of the best coffee shops with baked goods. Nice for meetings, unlike noisy crowded starb***s. They have live music on Fridays and Saturdays.
Great interior. Expensive
Good relaxing place to hang out with friends or watch the game.

THE BEST Coffee Shop in Charlotte, by far.  I came across this place while looking for an alternative to Starbucks & Caribou Coffee where I could have a clean, bright area to work and enjoy a coffee.  What I found was a much more than  a coffee shop-   this feels more like a modern restaurant/lounge.  First- the service is outstanding. Starting with Carlos, the team here is the best I have seen in a long time.  Maggie, Hazel and the team in the morning are very welcoming and accommodate almost any request for coffee/ food (e.g. I do not like Onions- so they made me a breakfast burrito without pico de gallo).  Other pluses:   The location is new, clean and modern.  Large windows create a well lit and bright environment.   The tall ceiling (2 floors) ensures that you can work here for an hour or two and avoid smelling like burnt coffee when you leave.  The music is appropriate but not overbearing like some other coffee shops.  Seating-  lots of seating- and comfortable seating.  Start to finish- my new place 100%.   Great quality product, great location and friendly intuitive service.   Excellent.

I don't know if it's the beautiful light that comes in from the windows in the morning, or the amazingly tasting coffee, maybe the games and books available for entertainment, or the harmonious design of the space, definitely the exceptional people that serve you. Everything about this place is mesmerizing and I will come here every time I have the chance. Thank you!

What a cool place!! My wife and I went for an after dinner coffee and found they have coffee cocktails too. Even better! Friendly service, cool vibe, and really good drinks. In addition to the coffee cocktails, they have traditional coffee drinks, specialty coffee drinks, beer, and wine as well. They also have a nice selection of baked goods and snacks. Lots of casual activities around like pool, Jenga, tic tac toe, board and card games, etc. Definitely plan on going back.
The coffee is just okay, and the service is really bad. Leaving two stars because they leave a design in the foam.

Such a beautiful space to work or hangout. To go upstairs you go past the bar to your right there is some stairs with lots of study space. I parked right in front of the building seems easy to find parking. The vibes are okay I feel like the staff is working on their computers while serving coffee? Lots of outdoor space for a large group as well.

This is a great spot with coffee, beer, and wine! They have a great inside seating area with a co-working space upstairs and plenty of outside seating. Oh and there is a POOL TABLE, so I might be a little bias on this one. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly! As an added benefit the coffee is great!  Highly recommend if your looking for a good place to get some work done, practice some self care, or mix up the classic coffee date!
By far my favorite coffee shop in charlotte. Great atmosphere, super friendly staff and owners, and always go out of there way to make your experience warm and welcoming. 10/10!

This is my go to coffee shop in CLT. Coming from, and being used to, the craft coffee culture in SoCal I was worried I wasn't going to be able to find comparable places in NC. Was I wrong! LTH coffee is delicious, the drinks are not too sweet (you can still taste the espresso!), and they've been getting more and more pastries in which is awesome!  I'd say I come here 4 days out of the week, just can't get enough! (Plus that they have a sweet co-working space and beer/wine on tap!)

This is a great new place that is built into an apartment complex, It comes with so many fun games, puzzles, a pool table, 4 restrooms and so much creative decorative details. I will definitely come here again. I saw many yummy pastries and the drip coffee I got was pretty darn good. It's a bit expensive but it's worth it.

Here with a friend that has a severe nut allergy - absolutely no warnings on their products  and she had a reaction. They failed to act or even apologize in any way, terrible display of management and responsibility. Did not even refund her.
Perfect place for a great coffee and relax environment to co-work. They also have a good selection of pastries, beer and wine. Everyone is super friendly and welcoming !
Really friendly service and the latte I'm currently drinking is a perfect balance of sweet and strong. I'll definitely be making this place a regular stop during my week.
Great coffee, even better service. Carlos and his team are the best.

Haven't had a chance to visit this location, but I used to frequent the 1776 Peach Tree Street location and Atlantic Station locations when I lived in Atlanta. I am a big time coffee drinker and spend most days working from coffee shops.  If this is anything like the  quality of the Atlanta locations, this a welcome addition to Charlotte's specialty (third-wave) coffee scene and provides another coffee shop of similar quality to Under Current and Not Just Coffee.  Land of Thousand Hills specializes exclusively in Rawandaan Coffee and has close partnership with specific farms. Their menu is pretty diverse offering traditional pour overs, drip coffee, lattes along with more Starbucks-esque offerings.
Super nice location, coffee,  pantries also games , pool and coffee comfortable work and meeting areas.
